How can I use the `getblock` command to retrieve information about a specific block in Verus?

You can use the `getblock` command by specifying the block hash or block height as an input parameter. For example, you can use the command `verus getblock "00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5"` to retrieve information about a block with the specified hash, or `verus getblock 12800` to retrieve information about block number 12800. Alternatively, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus node.

Result (for verbosity = 2):
{
 ...,           Same output as verbosity = 1.
 "tx" : [        (array of Objects) The transactions in the format of the getrawtransaction RPC. Different from verbosity = 1 "tx" result.
     ,...
 ],
 ,...           Same output as verbosity = 1.
}

Examples:
> verus getblock "00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": ["00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
> verus getblock 12800
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": [12800] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
